intro: Hololeion krameri, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial with bright yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant has small, silvery-gray leaves that help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Its root system is deep and fibrous, allowing it to access groundwater in dry conditions. Hololeion krameri plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing nectar for pollinators in desert ecosystems.
